intro: Cleidion spathulatum, commonly known as the broadleaf sycamore, is a deciduous tree native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often lobed or serrated. The tree produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its bark is thick and flaky, and it can reach heights of up to 30 meters in its natural habitat. Cleidion spathulatum is often found in moist, well-drained soils near rivers or in forested areas.
